status.bound: Cannot move, cannot do other physical actions except trying to break free, DISTRACTED and VULNERABLE as long as they remain Bound. Use an action to roll Athletics (or Strength -2) and become ENTANGLED with a success, or break free with a raise (p. 98). The grappler is VULNERABLE so long as they maintain the bind.
status.entangled: -2 to the character’s roll until the end of their next turn (p. 100).
status.distracted: Cannot move and is DISTRACTED as long as they remain Entangled. Use an action to roll Athletics (or Strength -2) and break free (p. 98).
status.prone: -2 Parry, -2 Fighting, -4 to be hit from range 3”+ (doesn’t stack with COVER), -4 damage from attack with Area of Effects, use 2” of Pace to crawl 1” or to stand up (p. 104).
status.shaken: Can only perform free actions (including normal movement, plus eventually running). Recover from being SHAKEN as free action with a Spirit roll at the start of the character’s turn (p. 94).
status.stunned: Can’t move nor take actions, is PRONE. DISTRACTED for one turn. VULNERABLE until a Vigor roll is made. Success means VULNERABLE for one more turn, raise no ill effects. (p. 106).

freeActions.name: Free Actions
freeActions.description: You can perform many actions are needed.

move.name: Move
move.description: Move up to your Pace in inches, up to once per turn. You don't need to move all at once, you can split it.

run.name: Run
run.description: Run up to once per turn, up to the result of your Running die. Other actions this turn get -2. You have to call this out at the beginning of your turn.

speak.name: Speak
speak.description: Speak one or two short sentences.

prone.name: Go Prone
prone.description: PRONE is a -4 COVER against ranged attacks from 3”+.

ask.name: Not Sure
ask.description: Not sure if an unusual action is free? Ask the GM.

multi.name: Multi-Action
multi.description: You can make up to 3 actions in one turn. Two actions: -2. Three actions: -4

attack.name: Attack
attack.description: You can attack an enemy with a melee or ranged weapon.

wildAttack.name: Wild Attack
wildAttack.description: +2 Fighting, +2 melee damage, but you are now VULNERABLE.

shot.name: Called Shot
shot.description: Limb: -2 (may DISARM, see page 100); Hand: -4 (may DISARM), Head/Vitals: -4 (+4 damage), Unarmored Area: -? (damage ignores Armor).

push.name: Push
push.description: Opposed Strength or Athletics (each one chooses) roll (+2 if moved 2” before pushing, +Shield Parry Bonus): push 1”, 2” with a raise. The foe also rolls Athletics (-2 if the pusher raised) to avoid falling PRONE.

grapple.name: Grapple
grapple.description: Opposed Athletics roll to ENTANGLE the target, or to BOUND (in this case the grappler is also VULNERABLE) with a raise .

defend.name: Defend
defend.description: Use the entire turn to DEFEND and gain +4 Parry. You can move up to your Pace (but not run), or stand still to avoid free attacks.

test.name: Test
test.description: Describe a TEST and roll a relevant Skill against the foe’s linked Attribute. Success: the foe is DISTRACTED or VULNERABLE, your choice. Raise: the foe is also SHAKEN.

support.name: Support
support.description: Describe how you help your ally’s Trait and roll your relevant Skill to give them +1 with a success, +2 with a raise (max +4).

aim.name: Aim
aim.description: Spend the entire turn (movement included) to lower by up to 4 points of penalties (from COVER, CALLED SHOT, Range…) OR add +2 to the first ranged attack of the next round.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reload typically requires an action. The specifics can depend on the type of weapon and any modifications or Edges (character abilities) that might apply. For instance, reloading a revolver one bullet at a time would take more actions without a speed loader than reloading a magazine-fed firearm.

addBenny.name: Give a Benny
addBenny.description: Give a bennie to a wild card
